Functions

00700_TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator
[GP_010_Properties]

Functions

 TestCase_GC001_Allocate1Time ()
 TestCase_GC002_Allocate10Times ()
 TestCase_GC003_AllocateUntilOutOfMemory ()
 TestCase_BC004_enumeratorNull ()

Detailed Description

Description:
: Allocate a new property enumerator.

TEE_Result TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator( [out] TEE_PropSetHandle* enumerator );

For this test, we will need at least one TA.

Pre: Open a session to a GPTA.

Post: Close session and check that it succeeds.

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC001_Allocate1Time (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05040000000000000000000000000001 6b28a6d436fe5fb9b5ed59cba151a0fc
Pre Conditions:
05040000000000000000000000000001.[drbin/tlbin] is loaded.
Focus:
Test the functionality of TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator().
Test Steps:
Call TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator() 1 time, verify that the result is TEE_SUCCESS Call TEE_FreePropertyEnumerator() to free the previously-allocated enumerator

TestCase_GC003_AllocateUntilOutOfMemory (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05040000000000000000000000000001 6b28a6d436fe5fb9b5ed59cba151a0fc
Pre Conditions:
05040000000000000000000000000001.[drbin/tlbin] is loaded.
Focus:
Test the functionality of TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator().
Test Steps:
In a loop until a TEE_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY return value is achieved
  • Allocate an enumerator in a linked list
  • Call TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator() and check that the result is TEE_SUCCESS or TEE_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY When the out of memory error is reached, check that the enumerator is assigned the value TEE_HANDLE_NULL When the out of memory error is reached, check that the enumerator is assigned the value TEE_HANDLE_NULL Allocate another enumerator in the linked list and call TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator() again and Check that the enumerator is assigned the value TEE_HANDLE_NULL In a loop until all enumerators are freed:
  • pseudo-randomly 10% of the time allocate a new enumerator and add it to the list
  • Pseudo-randomly pick an enumerator from the list of previously-allocated enumerators
  • Call TEE_FreePropertyEnumerator() to free the enumerator (if the value is not TEE_HANDLE_NULL) Call TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator() again and verify that the result is TEE_SUCCESS Call TEE_FreePropertyEnumerator() to free the enumerator
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
No
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_010_Properties.00700_TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator.GC003_AllocateUntilOutOfMemory
TestCase_BC004_enumeratorNull (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05040000000000000000000000000001 6b28a6d436fe5fb9b5ed59cba151a0fc
Pre Conditions:
05040000000000000000000000000001.[drbin/tlbin] is loaded.
Focus:
Call the API with a NULL pointer.
Test Steps:
Call TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator() with NULL enumerator pointer, should cause a TA panic

Free the enumerator with TEE_FreePropertyEnumerator()
